clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment Adherence to Injectable Methotrexate in Rheumatoid Arthritis
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment Adherence in Patients With Rheumatoid Arthritis Previously Treated With Oral or Injectable Methotrexate and Requiring a New Treatment With Injectable Methotrexate

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate, at 6 months, the rate of patients whose adherence to injectable MTX remained strong or improved according to patient-reported outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of patients whose adherence to methotrexate (MTX) remained strong or improved between inclusion (V0) and follow-up (V1) at 6 months.
primary_outcome.description: Patient adherence is measured via the Morisky score at V0 and V1, using patient-reported outcome (PRO).

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of patient adherence between the 2 cohorts.
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of improved or equivalent patient adherence as assessed by the Morisky score at V0 and V1 between the 2 cohorts.

secondary_outcome.measure: Reasons for non-adherence given by patients after 6 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed in the overall patient population and between the 2 cohorts.

secondary_outcome.measure: Global and functional patient satisfaction with treatment after 6 months as assessed by the Likert scale for global satisfaction.
secondary_outcome.description: Global patient satisfaction will be assessed in the overall patient population and between the 2 cohorts using the Likert scale (1 to 5 rating).

secondary_outcome.measure: Global and functional patient satisfaction with treatment after 6 months as assessed by the Disease Activity Score 28 (DAS28) for disease severity.
secondary_outcome.description: Patient satisfaction will be assessed in the overall patient population and between the 2 cohorts using the DAS28.

secondary_outcome.measure: Global and functional patient satisfaction with treatment after 6 months as assessed by the Health Assessment Questionnaire Disability Index (HAQ-DI) for functional disability.
secondary_outcome.description: Patient satisfaction will be assessed in the overall patient population and between the 2 cohorts using the HAQ-DI.

secondary_outcome.measure: Global and functional patient satisfaction with treatment after 6 months as assessed by the Echelle de Mesure de l'Impact de la polyarthrite Rhumato√Øde (EMIR) for quality of life.
secondary_outcome.description: Patient satisfaction will be assessed in the overall patient population and between the 2 cohorts using the EMIR.

secondary_outcome.measure: Analysis of improvement or maintenance of patient adherence, as evaluated by the change in the Morisky scores at V0 and V1, based on family situation.
secondary_outcome.description: Identification of factors associated with the improvement or maintenance of adherence in the overall patient population and between the 2 cohorts by assessing family situation. Adherence is evaluated by the change in the Morisky scores at V0 and V1, with a score of 0 considered as strong adherence and a score >0 considered as non-adherence. Patient adhesion is classified as remaining strong if the Morisky score at V0 and V1 remains at 0 and patient adhesion is classified as improved if the Morisky score at V0 is greater than 0 (non-adherent) while the score at V1 is 0 (strong adherence).

arm_group.description: Patients treated with oral MTX and requiring a switch to injectable MTX
Patients treated with injectable MTX and eligible for a change in MTX injection device.

study_pop.textblock: RA patients currently treated with oral methotrexate (MTX) and requiring a switch to injectable MTX or currently treated with an injectable MTX and eligible for a change to a different MTX injection device will be asked to participate from RA treatment change (inclusion visit) up to 6 months after inclusion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients (‚â• 18 years old)
- Patients with a diagnosis of RA as confirmed by the ACR/EULAR (2010) Classification Criteria for Rheumatoid Arthritis
- Patients:
- currently treated with oral MTX and requiring a switch to an injectable MTX* or
- currently treated with an injectable MTX* and eligible for a change of MTX injection device*
- Patients informed about and accepting the computer processing of their medical data and their right of accesss and correction.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who refuse to participate in the study or are unable to fill out the patient diary.
